citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
The facility has an incomplete written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). It currently states the attending veterinarian’s
name and the frequency of scheduled visits as annually. The written PVC has no specifics for veterinary care and instead
states that the program of veterinary care would be addressed in a protocol if USDA regulated animals are kept. Further,
the PVC states the registrant will perform euthanasia, but no euthanasia methods are described, and no provisions for
emergency/after-hours care are listed. Failure to provide a written program with sufficient detail may lead to a lack of
delivery of adequate veterinary care to the animals. A complete written program of veterinary care shall be developed and
meet regulatory requirements.
Correct by: 08/15/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.33(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
The facility has an incomplete written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). It currently states the attending veterinarian’s 
name and the frequency of scheduled visits as annually. The written PVC has no specifics for veterinary care and instead 
states that the program of veterinary care would be addressed in a protocol if USDA regulated animals are kept. Further, 
the PVC states the registrant will perform euthanasia, but no euthanasia methods are described, and no provisions for 
emergency/after-hours care are listed. Failure to provide a written program with sufficient detail may lead to a lack of 
delivery of adequate veterinary care to the animals. A complete written program of veterinary care shall be developed and 
meet regulatory requirements.  
Correct by: 08/15/2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
